render.tex: \title{Simplest Set Results} The most intuitive and easiest to remember results involving two sets $A$ and $B$

reason.tex:
%text The table below summarizes standard results that are the easiest to remember and which you can -- with some care -- prove easily using Venn diagrams $U$ is the universal set and $\phi$ an empty set % \begin{align} \begin{tabular}{NNN}
\hline \text{Union} & \text{Intersection} & \text{Complement} \\ \hline A\cup B = B\cup A & A\cap B = B\cap A & A\cup A' = U \\ \hline A \cup \phi = A & A\cap \phi = \phi & A\cap A' = \phi \\ \hline A\cup A = A & A\cap A = A & \left(A' \right)' = A \\ \hline A\cup U = U & A\cap U = A & U' = \phi \\ \hline & & \phi' = U \\ \hline \end{tabular} \end{align} %text %
